<a href="https://justworks.com/lp/morning-brew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=display&utm_campaign=fy22_q1_august_morningbrew_newsletter" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Justworks" style="width:100%;max-width: 116px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="116" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby81MTIvMTYwOTE3NDEwMi1KdXN0d29ya3MtbG9nb19fMDAyXy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>
</th>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Big news in the world of karaoke: China’s Ministry of Culture and Tourism is <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/08/11/1026718505/china-karaoke-blacklist-banned-songs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banning</a> the use of songs at karaoke bars that contain “illegal content,” like those that violate the country’s religious policies or glorify violence.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US should do this, too, but only ban songs that people are actually good at. Karaoke is for bad singing only.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/11/facing-higher-gas-prices-us-asks-opec-produce-oil?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Gas Prices Are Too Damn High
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="station wagon with suitcases on top being filled with gas" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDkzL3ZhY2F0aW9uLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pros of going to a gas station (great smell) are beginning to get outweighed by the cons (surging prices), and the White House is scrambling to do something about it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Biden administration yesterday asked OPEC+ to <a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-prices-c56b5ffcef37223caaec19e3b3428392?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">please produce more oil</a>, arguing that high costs at the pump are harming the economic recovery. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>OPEC is a group of countries that collectively produce ~40% of the world’s crude oil.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They’ve recently expanded into OPEC+, which in fact is not a streaming service but a broader group of major oil-exporting nations that includes Russia.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>During those unprecedented times last spring, OPEC+ slashed production by an unprecedented amount—nearly 10 million barrels/day. The group recently agreed to gradually ramp up output over the next year, but the US thinks that’s not enough to meet greater demand for gas and keep prices from taking a bite out of Americans’ wallets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Run the numbers on gas prices:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The national average yesterday was $3.185/gallon, </span><span><a href="https://gasprices.aaa.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to AAA</a></span><span>. A year ago, it was $2.174.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In May, the national average </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/11/as-gas-prices-rise-white-house-says-opec-action-is-simply-not-enough-calls-for-ftc-scrutiny.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topped $3</a></span><span> for the first time since 2014.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, gas isn’t the only thing that’s expensive these days. Consumer prices <a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-prices-8123e0ab46f71bef25a41b16da626201?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped 5.4%</a> annually in July, the Labor Department revealed yesterday, confirming that inflation is a defining characteristic of the post-lockdown economy. But the report also offered ammo to the economists who say higher inflation is temporary—the rate of growth in prices slowed down from June. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>will OPEC change its strategy because of the US? Not on your nelly. An official from Saudi Arabia, the world’s biggest oil producer, said it was rich that the US was asking for more oil when it's also on a high-profile mission to curb emissions. Another OPEC delegate responded that the spread of the Delta variant means a full recovery in demand for fuel is anything but certain. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/11/samsung-doubling-foldable-phones-newest-launch?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Samsung Wants to Know: Do You Fold Your Phone Hamburger or Hot Dog?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/11/samsung-doubling-foldable-phones-newest-launch?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 with pen and Galaxy Z Flip3 leaned up next to it with a text notification from Samsung that reads, "Hey there!"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTk3L3NhbXN1bmdfZm9sZGFibGVfcGhvbmVzLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Samsung</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Innovation is a circle, and Samsung is bullish about its foldable phone lineup. Yesterday, the Korean tech giant <a href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-z-fold-3-z-flip-3-galaxy-buds-2-and-watch-4-samsung-just-unpacked-them-all/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> two new smartphones: the Galaxy Z Fold3, which folds out like a book into a 7.6-inch tablet, and the Galaxy Z Flip3, whose vertical orientation lets you relive your early 2000s flip-phone fantasies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">They’re not the first of their kind. </strong>In 2019, Samsung <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/07/25/samsung-resurrects-its-folding-phone-three-months-after-abruptly-canceling-its-launch/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> its OG foldable phone after delaying the rollout over durability concerns. That phone was clunky, cost $2,000, and was described as an “expensive experiment.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s different this time is...just about everything:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The higher-end Z Fold3 costs $1,800 while the Z Flip3 costs $1,000, finally putting a foldable phone in a similar price bracket as an iPhone.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Both phones are water resistant, sturdier, and have updated software.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Samsung needs to convince consumers that foldable phones are more than just a gimmick. Only 2 million foldable phones were shipped last year out of 1.3 billion total smartphones, per research firm International Data Corp.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/11/hackers-steal-600-million-crypto?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Thomas Crypto Affair
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/11/hackers-steal-600-million-crypto?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Swiper from Dora the Explorer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=381 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/11UjO5ezHZgMHC/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Swiper from Dora the Explorer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/11UjO5ezHZgMHC/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Tuesday, hackers pulled off one of the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/11/22619272/poly-network-attack-600-million-cryptocurrency-theft-doge-ethereum-binance-return-defi?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest heists</a> in crypto history, stealing more than $600 million from decentralized finance (DeFi) platform Poly Network. Within a day, the thieves started sending back scoops of their cryptocurrency trail mix, which included ether, bitcoin, dogecoin, and hundreds of others. $256 million was returned as of yesterday afternoon.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How they pulled it off is still being investigated, but in an online Q&A, the hackers said they spotted a bug and <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-11/hackers-return-funds-from-likely-record-defi-crypto-attack?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made off</a> with their haul “to keep it safe.” Also, “for fun:).” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why return it?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s possible the bandits were intimidated by Poly Network, which posted a tweet warning the cybercriminals that they "will be pursued" by law enforcement and that it would be “unwise for you to do any further transactions.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Illicit activity in the cryptocurrency space has been ramping up, especially in the emerging sector of decentralized finance—which includes a variety of blockchain-conducted <a href="https://www.coindesk.com/what-is-defi?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">financial applications</a>. Government regulators and independent companies are racing to figure out how to fight back.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Khaled Desouki/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Despite having about 17% of the world’s population, Africa accounts for <a href="https://qz.com/africa/2044601/moove-ubers-financing-partner-in-africa-raises-23-million/?utm_source=email&utm_medium=daily-brief&utm_content=5e2be483-fa7d-11eb-8eb8-86e25f32840b" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just 1%</a> of new car sales globally (and South Africa for 85% of those), according to the research firm Mordor Intelligence. Securing financing at favorable loan terms is a major hurdle, and in many African countries, customers must pay the full cost of the car up-front.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Nobody will ever describe my administration as a toxic work environment.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In her first press briefing after New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced his resignation, Lt. Gov. Kathy Hochul, his successor, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/andrew-cuomo-health-coronavirus-pandemic-cf6794c4cf5a82d6be7739009b8fe8fe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vowed</a> to change the workplace culture of the governor’s office.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/11/jeopardy-announces-two-new-hosts-mayim-bialik-mike-richards?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
‘Jeopardy!’ Doubles Its Hosts in Just One Week
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/11/jeopardy-announces-two-new-hosts-mayim-bialik-mike-richards?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A photo of the two new Jeopardy hosts" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjAwL3RoZV90d29fbmV3X2plb3BhcmR5X2hvc3RzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Earl Gibson III and Matt Winkelmeyer for Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The iconic game show and <em>SNL</em>’s favorite crutch <a href="https://www.thedailybeast.com/jeopardy-set-to-announce-mayim-bialik-and-mike-richards-splitting-host-duties?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> not one, but two new hosts: <em>Jeopardy!</em> executive producer Mike Richards and actress Mayim Bialik.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bialik is known for her role in <em>The Big Bang Theory</em> and will be the show’s first permanent female host. She’ll run the podium for specials like the new college championship tournament next year, while Richards, a former host of the reality show <em>Beauty and the Geek</em>, will step in for standard shows.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>When rumors first circulated last week that Richards might get the hosting role, fans </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/05/arts/television/mike-richards-jeopardy-host.html?action=click&module=RelatedLinks&pgtype=Article" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criticized</a></span><span> his coziness to the hiring process and his involvement in discrimination lawsuits during his time as executive producer of </span><span><em>The Price Is Right</em></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> The journey to find a new host took longer than the groan we let out when seeing the “Opera” category on the board. The show has tapped 16 guest hosts, including NFL QB Aaron Rodgers, journalist Robin Roberts, and the beloved actor LeVar Burton, since former host, TV icon Alex Trebek, died last November.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Jeopardy!</em>’s 38th season will start September 13.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

The Puzzle Section

</td>

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>The time to beat this week is 31 seconds. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/11/brew-mini-goalllllll?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">See if you can do it</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real, and one is faker than a Philadelphia roll. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Scientists </span><span><a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/scientists-tweak-daddy-long-legs-genes-to-create-daddy-short-legs/?PostType=link&UniqueID=71E8378E-F566-11EB-9D91-61D64744363C&ServiceType=twitter&TheTime=2021-08-04T20:56:31&ftag=COS-05-10aaa0b" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweak</a></span><span> daddy long legs genes to create daddy short legs</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

countries that collectively produce ~40% of the world’s crude oil.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey’ve recently expanded into OPEC+, which in fact is not a streaming service but a broader group of major oil-exporting nations that includes Russia.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eDuring those unprecedented times last spring, OPEC+ slashed production by an unprecedented amount—nearly 10 million barrels/day. The group recently agreed to gradually ramp up output over the next year, but the US thinks that’s not enough to meet greater demand for gas and keep prices from taking a bite out of Americans’ wallets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRun the numbers on gas prices:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe national average yesterday was $3.185/gallon, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://gasprices.aaa.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to AAA\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. A year ago, it was $2.174.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn May, the national average \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/11/as-gas-prices-rise-white-house-says-opec-action-is-simply-not-enough-calls-for-ftc-scrutiny.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped $3\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for the first time since 2014.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, gas isn’t the only thing that’s expensive these days. Consumer prices \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-prices-8123e0ab46f71bef25a41b16da626201?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped 5.4%\u003c/a\u003e annually in July, the Labor Department revealed yesterday, confirming that inflation is a defining characteristic of the post-lockdown economy. But the report also offered ammo to the economists who say higher inflation is temporary—the rate of growth in prices slowed down from June. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewill OPEC change its strategy because of the US? Not on your nelly. An official from Saudi Arabia, the world’s biggest oil producer, said it was rich that the US was asking for more oil when it's also on a high-profile mission to curb emissions. Another OPEC delegate responded that the spread of the Delta variant means a full recovery in demand for fuel is anything but certain. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInnovation is a circle, and Samsung is bullish about its foldable phone lineup. Yesterday, the Korean tech giant \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-z-fold-3-z-flip-3-galaxy-buds-2-and-watch-4-samsung-just-unpacked-them-all/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e two new smartphones: the Galaxy Z Fold3, which folds out like a book into a 7.6-inch tablet, and the Galaxy Z Flip3, whose vertical orientation lets you relive your early 2000s flip-phone fantasies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThey’re not the first of their kind. \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2019, Samsung \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/07/25/samsung-resurrects-its-folding-phone-three-months-after-abruptly-canceling-its-launch/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e its OG foldable phone after delaying the rollout over durability concerns. That phone was clunky, cost $2,000, and was described as an “expensive experiment.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat’s different this time is...just about everything:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe higher-end Z Fold3 costs $1,800 while the Z Flip3 costs $1,000, finally putting a foldable phone in a similar price bracket as an iPhone.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBoth phones are water resistant, sturdier, and have updated software.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eSamsung needs to convince consumers that foldable phones are more than just a gimmick. Only 2 million foldable phones were shipped last year out of 1.3 billion total smartphones, per research firm International Data Corp.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Within a day, the thieves started sending back scoops of their cryptocurrency trail mix, which included ether, bitcoin, dogecoin, and hundreds of others. $256 million was returned as of yesterday afternoon.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow they pulled it off is still being investigated, but in an online Q\u0026A, the hackers said they spotted a bug and \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-11/hackers-return-funds-from-likely-record-defi-crypto-attack?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade off\u003c/a\u003e with their haul “to keep it safe.” Also, “for fun:).” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy return it?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s possible the bandits were intimidated by Poly Network, which posted a tweet warning the cybercriminals that they \"will be pursued\" by law enforcement and that it would be “unwise for you to do any further transactions.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Illicit activity in the cryptocurrency space has been ramping up, especially in the emerging sector of decentralized finance—which includes a variety of blockchain-conducted \u003ca href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/what-is-defi?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinancial applications\u003c/a\u003e. November.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eJeopardy!\u003c/em\u003e’s 38th season will start September
